page.title: 12Travel round Holbeach Bank
page.content: The A17 leads to Sleaford, Newark and Norfolk. Lots of big vehicles use it. There are jams in the summer. There are accidents on the bends in Saracen's Head, so a new road is being planned. The country roads are very narrow. Some tracks leading to the farms are not metalled. They are stony. The heavy lorries and tractors that come from farms bring loads of supplies for factories. The big lorries and tractors are hard to overtake. Some people said that the country roads should be wider. Others said that they should be only wider in the villages. There are no footpaths on the country roads and it can be dangerous when big vehicles go past. There is one public service bus a week. It runs on Saturdays and takes people to Boston for shopping.
